intro: Exitelia, commonly known as the genus of flowering plants in the family Poaceae, comprises grass-like species that are often found in temperate and subtropical regions. These plants typically exhibit narrow, linear leaves and produce small, spike-like inflorescences. Many species within the genus are adapted to thrive in disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, roadsides, and other open habitats. They play a role in soil stabilization and provide forage for grazing animals. Some species are also cultivated for ornamental purposes due to their aesthetic appeal.
